answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems.Commonest cause of chronic nausea is acidity. Take omeprazole (empty stomach in morning) and antacid gel and see if it helps. Liver and kidney dysfunction is another cause. Hence kidney and liver function tests should be done. Other causes are diabetes and hypothyroidism. Electrolyte imbalance too can cause nausea. IBS (this you have so can be the cause of nausea), gluten or lactose intolerance, parasites in gut too can be the cause. A stool test should be done for worms, giardiasis etc. Keep a food diary and see if there is a co-relation between what you eat and symptoms that appear.Please consult your doctor regarding this. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I have been diagnosed 5 years ago with microscopic colitis.  I've had IBS for 30+ years (diarrhea); I have right sided pain on and off, worsening around the time of my periods.  I have had nausea on a daily basis flaring up in the evenings for 9 years now.  No doctor seems to know why.  Could this be something other than a GI problem?
title: Chronic GI problems
